quiz.question: What term describes calories that provide little vitamins or minerals?
What is the thermic effect of food (TEF)?
options: Energy stored as fat after eating
Energy used to digest, absorb, and process nutrients
quiz.answer: Energy used to digest, absorb, and process nutrients

quiz.question: Which minor component can yield measurable caloric value through gut microbiota fermentation?
Which beverage contains calories despite not being a food?
Which label term indicates the amount of a nutrient per serving relative to daily intake?
Which measurement concept addresses energy available after accounting for microbial and enzymatic losses?
Which macronutrient is especially important for muscle repair after exercise?
Which sugar alcohol is often labeled as near-zero calories and used in reduced-calorie products?
Which change in the US Nutrition Facts label increased emphasis on public health priorities?
Which macronutrient provides about 7 kilocalories per gram?
What effect does soluble fiber have on blood glucose after a meal?
options: It converts glucose into fat instantly
It slows glucose absorption and moderates blood sugar rise
quiz.answer: It slows glucose absorption and moderates blood sugar rise

quiz.question: Which value best describes the general Atwater energy factors for carbs, protein, and fat?
Which macronutrient often appears highest in nuts and oils?
Which common misconception about calories is often incorrect?
options: All calories have identical metabolic effects in every context
Fat is more calorie-dense than carbohydrates
quiz.answer: All calories have identical metabolic effects in every context

quiz.question: Which measurement compares caloric contribution adjusted for absorption and urinary losses?
